data.title: Items and Item
data.solution:
import sys
import math

items = []

n = int(input())  # Number of items in the list
for i in range(n):
    item = input()  # An item in the list

    items.append(item)

# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)

if n == 1:
    print(items[0])
elif n == 2:
    print(f'{items[0]} and {items[1]}')
else:
    print(', '.join(items[:-1]) + f' and {items[-1]}')
data.statement:
You are given an integer [[n]] and a list of [[n]] strings. Your task is to write a program that will print a single line, displaying the items of the list with commas between them and an {{and}} before the last item. 

Your program should be able to handle various scenarios, including single-item lists and names with spaces. Refer to the input-output section for better understanding.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut: apple, banana, pineapple, orange and mango

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testOut: banana, orange, mango, apple and pineapple

testCases.title: Test 4
testCases.testIn:
4
Kirra Belle
Demi Jo
Mary Jane
James Dean
testCases.testOut: Kirra Belle, Demi Jo, Mary Jane and James Dean

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
4
Mary Jane
Demi Jo
Kirra Belle
James Dean
testCases.testOut: Mary Jane, Demi Jo, Kirra Belle and James Dean

write answer

STATEMENT

n: Number of items in the list
item: An item in the list
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]], number of items in the list
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> A string, an [[item]] of the list
data.outputDescription: One line consists of items from the list, separated by comma(s) ({{,}}) and the last item should be separated by {{and}} instead of a comma, as we write in normal English.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given an integer n and a list of n strings. Your task is to write a program that will print a single line, displaying the items of the list with commas between them and an and before the last item.

Your program should be able to handle various scenarios, including single-item lists and names with spaces. Refer to the input-output section for better understanding.
Input
Line 1: An integer n, number of items in the list
Next n lines: A string, an item of the list
Output
One line consists of items from the list, separated by comma(s) (,) and the last item should be separated by and instead of a comma, as we write in normal English.
Constraints
Example
Input
5
apple
banana
pineapple
orange
mango
Output
apple, banana, pineapple, orange and mango
